Report operators: Fastweb in clear growth, TIM the one that invests the most, and not only in Italy (photo)
07 Nov 2019, 22:54 by Matteo Bottin
The Mediobanca Research Area on the TLC sector has published a survey concerning the major Italian, European and international operators for 2018. The data that emerge are certainly very interesting.
First of all, in the European market ours is the fourth in size, behind Germany, the United Kingdom and France. In terms of national GDP, in Italy the telecommunications sector represents 1.8%, while it reaches 5.9% of total investments (net of the 5G auction). In 2018, the market suffered a slight decrease (31.6 billion euros, or -2%) mainly due to the decline in the mobile sector (-5.3%).
However, the increase in infrastructure investments (8.4 billion euros, + 17%) bodes well for which TIM is the supreme leader: in 2018 it invested 34.7% of turnover, higher than giants like AT&T (12.2%) and Vodafone Group (18.5%). TIM is always first also as regards investments in the 2016-18 three-year period.
However, if we look at turnover, although TIM is sixth in Europe (18.9 billion), the only growing operator is Fastweb, with + 8.2% compared to 2017 and + 24.6% compared to 5 years ago. TIM drops by 4.2%, Vodafone by 5.6% and Wind Tre by 9.9% (all figures comparing 2018 to 2017). The worst, however, was Tiscali, with -18% compared to 2018 and -22.4% compared to 2014. The same trend was recorded in the first 6 months of 2019.
But there are many other data in the Mediobanca report: in mid-2019 Iliad is close to Poste Mobile as market shares (3.7% against 4%), the US telecommunications market is the most important and Vodafone Group is the operator with greater financial strength.
